name: src/docs/script/test-summary.js
src/js/compass.js
Compass
description:
The compass class encapsulates logic around rendering the actual Compass
based on device orientation data.

name: constructor
description: Creates a compass from a HTML element

name: setAngle
description: Sets rotation of the compass

name: setMarkerPosition
description: Sets the POI marker position on the compass

name: renderMarker
description: Renders the POI marker on the compass. Offset is used in case compass is near 0

name: render
description: Renders the compass

name: src/js/location.js
Location
description: The location class encapsulates all the needed identifiers for PlacesAR purposes

name: constructor
description: Constructor sets the default values of member variables.

name: src/js/main.js
Main
description:
Main class that handles all the basic functionality of
the web app like buttons and initializes other components
like the Compass, Settings or Map.

name: constructor
description: Constructor creates new Position object and initializes the app.

name: runSetupWizard
description: Runs setup wizard if setup hasn't been completed yet

name: initEvents
description: Binds event handlers to events for basic GUI operations.

name: initVideo
description:
This function initializes the video stream from the environment-facing
camera. Uses the getUserMedia/Stream API present in all current browsers.
Uses quality set in app settings.

name: fullScreenChange
description:
fullScreenChange handles fullscreen events and updates
the fullscreen toggle button accordingly.

name: src/js/map.js
Map
description:
This class encapsulates Google Maps and everything related to it. 
Meant to make it easier in case we decide to go with another provider.

name: constructor
description: Constructor initializes map from the map provider (Google Maps) and ad

params.name: callback
params.description: Callback for when user select different POI

name: setCenter
description: Moves the center of the map to keep track of the user

name: src/js/pid-controller.js
PID_Controller
description:
PID Controller implementation in JavaScript
Adapted from https://github.com/br3ttb/Arduino-PID-Library
Based on https://codepen.io/sbrekken/pen/juxzs

name: constructor
description: Creates a PID controller

name: setOutputLimits
description: Sets output limits so the PID controller doesn't go crazy

name: setTarget
description: Sets the desired value

name: compute
description:
Computes the controller output based on what the current value is. Is sampled
based on the sample time set in constrictor.

name: src/js/position-service.js
toRad
description: This makes it possible to convert number from degrees to radians.

name: toDeg
description: This makes it possible to convert number from radians to degrees.

name: PositionService
description:
This class encapsulates everything related to position. Contains
current position and selected POI position.

name: constructor
description:
The constructor binds device orientation events and creates the Compass and Map
objects. Also Geolocation watcher and Location is initialized here.

name: initGeolocationWatcher
description: Initializes the geolocation watcher. Uses Max Age set in settings.

name: reinitGeolocationWatcher
description: Reinitializes geolocation watcher

name: listenerSwitch
description:
This function turns off the relative position deviceorientation listener if the
deviceorientationabsolute is provided by the browser.

name: confirmSelect
description:
This function is run after user selects new POI to update the Position
object with the new one and recompute all important data.

name: locationUpdate
description: Event handler for the GeolocationWatcher that recomputes distance and updates bearing.

params.name: position
params.description: New position provided by the watcher

name: locationUpdateFail
description: Location error handler

name: formatDistance
description: Makes a formatted string (metric system) from a number representing the distance in meters.

name: distanceFromCoords
description: Computes distance between two locations using the Haversine formula

name: absBearing
description: Computes bearing between two locations

name: deviceOrientationChange
description:
Device orientation change event handler. Normalizes the values and updates compass accordingly.
If position is relative, then it displays warning.

name: normalizeBearing
description: Normalizes bearing to the 0-360 range

name: startCalibration
description: Starts the calibration process and sets geolocation watcher to high speed

name: endCalibration
description: Finishes the calibration process and resets geolocation watcher

name: postProcessCalibrationData
description: Processes calibration data so that problems with overroll around north are eliminated

name: src/js/position-service.test.js
src/js/settings.js
Settings
description: This class manages settings and applying them.

name: constructor
description:
Constructor sets the default values of member variables. Also initializes the event listeners
for range sliders and the save event.

name: setDefaults
description: If not defined yet, set the default values of settings

name: init
description: Sets the saved values to the inputs.

name: saveSettings
description: Saves settings and does all actions needed to apply them.

name: src/js/stat_tools.js
mean
description: Computes mean from array of numbers

name: standardDeviation
description: Computes standard deviation from array of numbers

name: median
description: Computes median from array of numbers

name: MAD
description:
Iglewicz and Hoaglin method (median absolute deviation method)
Values with a Z-score > 3.5 are considered potential outliers
Based on https://github.com/alyssaq/stats-analysis

name: src/js/wizard.js
Wizard
description: Wizard class starts and handles the wizards that are displayed on first start and when location fix is needed

name: constructor
description: Initializes the wizard, if run once is true, checks whether wizard already ran using WebStorage.

params.name: runOnce
params.description: whether to run wizard only once

name: finished
description: Hides the wizard and if it should be run only once, writes true to WebStorage.

name: hideAllWizards
description: Hides all wizards

name: vibrateAlert
description: Vibrates phone to notify user of location fix

params.name: count
params.description: Couns how many vibrations took place

content:
# Places AR

![Screenshot](https://sajdl.com/data/img/chrome.jpg "Screenshot")

This is the app made for the software project and my bachelor thesis. The goal is to make a simple web app that can help you find your desired point of interest using Augmented reality and Device APIs such as DeviceOrientation API. All browser implementations are not made the same, so we have to apply north-detection for browsers such as Mozilla Firefox that do not provide absolute position values.

A SSL certificate is needed for this to function correctly, because Location API needs secure connection to work :wink:
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "places-ar",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Vyhledvn bod zjmu pomoc rozen reality ve Vaem prohlei!",
  "author": "Vojtch Sajdl <vojtech@sajdl.com> (https://sajdl.com)",
  "license": "Apache-2.0",
  "browserslist": ">1% and last 2 versions, not IE > 0, not IE_Mob > 0, not op_mini > 0,  not dead",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/Pryx/places-ar.git"
  },
  "main": "src/js/main.js",
  "scripts": {
    "build-prod": "webpack --env.prod --config webpack.config.js",
    "build": "webpack --config webpack.config.js",
